madrid.name: Parque del Retiro
madrid.description: One of Madrid’s largest parks featuring gardens, boating lake and the iconic Crystal Palace.
madrid.details: Located in the heart of Madrid, Retiro Park offers over 125 hectares of peace and culture, featuring fountains, statues, exhibitions and a rowing lake.

madrid.name: Museo del Prado
madrid.description: World‑renowned art museum housing masterpieces by Goya, Velázquez and El Greco.
madrid.details: The Prado Museum contains one of the finest collections of European art, dating from the 12th century to the early 20th century.

madrid.name: Plaza Mayor
madrid.description: Historic grand square from the 17th century, surrounded by arcades and cafes.
madrid.details: A central plaza in Madrid, the Plaza Mayor is known for its symmetrical architecture and vibrant atmosphere.

barcelona.name: Sagrada Família
barcelona.description: Antoni Gaudí’s masterpiece – a still‑unfinished basilica with stunning architecture.
barcelona.details: An iconic symbol of Barcelona, the basilica is renowned for its elaborate facades and unique design blending Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

barcelona.name: Park Güell
barcelona.description: Colorful park with Gaudí‑designed mosaic structures and panoramic views of the city.
barcelona.details: A UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with serpentine benches, colorful tile work, and architectural surprises across its scenic gardens.

prague.name: Charles Bridge
prague.description: Iconic historic bridge lined with statues, offering views of Prague Castle.
prague.details: A pedestrian-only bridge from the 14th century featuring 30 baroque-style statues and connecting the Old Town with Prague Castle.

prague.name: Prague Castle
prague.description: Largest ancient castle complex in the world, with cathedral, museums and gardens.
prague.details: Dating back to the 9th century, Prague Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the Czech president.
